Blog.post: Well, I have a large music collection now (compared to what I had before, anyway). I got all of the cd's down, so now I'm just enjoying them and doing my thing. I've really not got anything to do, and I'm supposed to be in bed, but whatever. I'm not going anywhere anytime soon.... I should plan an outfit for tomorrow or something... I don't think I've ever done that before... except for weddings and stuff. Anyway, it's time for me to lie about going to bed. I'm going to bed now. (You're being lied to) Current Music: Queens of the Stoneage - No One Knows

Well, here I am, at my sister's house. Nothing going on really, hence my appearance on the computer. We went out and ran errands yesterday, and last night I acquired a bag of cd's to go copy onto my computer, but other than that we've just been sitting around the house. I saw this interesting show called 'Faking It' on TLC, where they take some random person (in this case a sheep-sheering kid from Colorado) and give them a couple weeks to learn a different profession (ie Hairstyling), and at the end, stick him in with a couple of seasoned pros to see if a judge can tell the difference. It was actually pretty cool, so I might have to watch that show again some time... Anyway, I'm off now. I think I'll be home soon. Current Music: Cranberries - Linger
Well, I was right. She is pissed .... Anyway, I'm going over to my sister's, so I'll get back to you later. Currenty Music: U2 - With or Without You

Well, I just wanted to make one more post before I go to bed... not much to say, though. Actually, I might not go to bed. I haven't quite decided yet... I probably will, though. Whatever. I don't have anything better to do. I'm supposed to go to Katy's tomorrow for her birthday, and I don't think I can go. She's gonna kill me... Ok, well, I'm going to either go to bed or find something to do, now. Current Music: Elton John - Your Song

Vanilla Sky is a very, very cool movie. I love movies that make you think like that... You know... those movies that the general public absolutely hates, because they're too stupid to understand them? The only movies like that that get any respect are the film festival ones, because they're often expected to be weird. Meh, whatever. Society sucks, anyway. Current Music: Gary Jules - Mad World

Well, my parents went to the Folklife Festival, whereas I did not. Nate wants me to help with his periodic table, Martin wants me to set up a webpage for him, and I want to do my english homework... I suppose I can fit that all into one day. Anyway, I'll be off now, for the time being. Current Music: The Mars Volta - Roulette Dares (The Haunt Of)

To bed it is, but I must say I'm quite satisfied with this blog. It has a much cooler feeling to it than LiveJournal, for one, and I like going in and changing little snippets... Anyway, here my day ends. Current Music: Franz Ferdinand - Take Me Out

I don't know what it is, but I love this hat... It's like the ultimate driving hat, and it adds just the right amount of character... I suppose it's the one thing that gives my average outfit a little boost, and makes me actually have a unique appearance. It's funny, though, because I usually hate wearing hats, but this one is mass comfortable and everything. Right, well, that's that. I just went to the store to get donuts and Whoop Ass... I'm set for tomorrow morning. My parents want me to go to the Folklife Festival in Seattle tomorrow, and I haven't quite decided if I want to go.. Meh. I think I'll go back to working on that website. Oh, the old one is www.chiefkitsapss.com You can see that they need it Current Music: Cutting Crew - I Just Died in Your Arms Tonight

I love how you can update this via email... it's so much more convenient. Especially since I made a mailto shortcut on my desktop... I'm making a redesigned site for my ski school... hope Brad likes it Current Music: The Mars Volta - Cicatriz ESP

Well, I've looked through the site, and I must say the control they give you over these things is awesome, so I think I'll be using this for quite some time. I'll have to make a custom template some time when I'm not being so lazy. Anyway, I'm off to do something. Current Music: The Beatles - Hey Jude
*clicks mouth and turns head* This looks like the beginning of a beautiful friendship...

More networking stuffs... I've connected one computer so far, just because I have to wait for my group to build their computers, whereas Christian and Nate already have their clients. Oh, well. Anyway, yeah. Off with me. Current Music: Alizée - J'En Ai Marre

Well, we created user accounts for the rest of the class, and I must say, I feel godly. It's awesome. There are so many things you can do with 2003 Server... I love it. I bought Melody AM, and a new cd case, so now I can fit all of my cd's in one place. Anyway, I'm off again. Current Music: Royksopp - Sparks

Yeah... the networking class is awesome. I'm glad I didn't let the prison resemblence fool me. The parking lot sucks, and I'm really not so sure about the school, but the class itself is like sugar-coated... ethernet cables... or something. Anyway, I'm in the server group, installing and running Windows 2003 Server to create a domain for the rest of the class. There's also the Windows Xp Group, who connect to the network or something, and then the Network group, who actually program the routers and run the ethernet cables around and stuff. And then there's the Hardware group, who apparently put computers together. We already have a bunch of working computers, but I guess we'll have more or something. Anyway, I'm off to... well, I was going to sleep, but that wasn't really working, so instead I'm just laying on the floor. It's all good either way, though. So, yes. Until tomorrow. Current Music: Rupert Hine - Arrested By You
Well, I have class tomorrow... that'll be interesting... I should really be in bed, though. So, yeah. I'm off to bed Current Music: No Doubt - Don't Speak

Well, we stayed up really late last night playing an insanely boring game of Starcraft. It was a special map, as opposed to original... you start with a single marine, as does everyone else. There are zerg and protoss computers all around the outside of the map, and five invincible bunkers in the middle. So, each player gets their own bunker to hide in. Also, if you stand in the center of the map, it's a healing zone, so you can just stand there and hit the stim pack button if there isn't too much stuff attacking, and you'll be able to hold it off. Finally, there's an array of buildings around the outside of the center (so not as far out as the enemies) and they all have corresponding beacons. So, if your unit stands on a beacon, you control the building and you can build more units or upgrade. The only way you get money to do that is by killing things. Finally, to finish the game, someone has to make it to one of the 4 crystals in the corners of the map, which are insanely well guarded. Long game. Ok, I'm going to my brother's house today, and won't be back until late tomorrow, so everyone have fun doing whatever you're doing. Current Music: The Mars Volta - Drunkship of Lanterns

Well, I'm back again. Summer is turning boring again... I played a bit of Onimusha, and it's interesting, to say the least. Oh, we got our Rav4 back yesterday, and I drove it today... it feels odd to drive it, now Anyway, I'm off again, because... yeah. Current Music: Franz Ferdinand - Take Me Out

Yeah... well, now I've gotten some sleep, but my heart and mind are still twisted around, slowly attempting to return to their original states. Anyway, I'm going to go shower and eat breakfast and stuff, so I'll be back later. Current Music: My Bloody Valentine - When You Sleep

That game was so fucking awesome. I almost wish I hadn't beat it, just so I could still be stuck deep down in the plot, ignorant to everything around me. That game changed the way I think, it was so cool. Also, I've decided that the people at Ubisoft are my gods. I'm going to build an altar and worship them. Fuck, I wanna work there... Splinter Cell, XIII, and now Prince of Persia. Ubisoft is on top of things. You know, it was really revolutionary. Not only did it make you think from start to finish through the puzzles (mindless puzzles have been all the rage lately), which were the core element of the game, but the plot was a rollercoaster of heart twinges, satisfied sighs, and tears of joy. Some people play games for the action, some people for the challenge, some for the story. I play for the story. Any game that doesn't have good character development and a wicked plot is meaningless to me. Like Spyhunter... that was interesting, because they attempted to have a plot built into a racing game--big mistake. That game was horrible. More babbling, because I'm still awestruck XIII -- a beautifully rendered identity crisis with plot twists so awesome it makes your head spin. Totally my kind of game. Splinter Cell -- Stealth action redefined. I love being sneaky, and Splinter Cell was the first stealth game to really take the initiative to offer oodles of movement options (split jumps, zip lines, etc.) and still keep a clean interface. Prince of Persia -- The ultimate puzzle game/the ultimate time travel game (in a way)/the ultimate story-driven game. Even if it didn't have any replay value (which it does) I would have to buy it anyway, just because it would be blasphemy not to. You know what, this is crap, and I'm tired, so I'll just post tomorrow when I'm awake, and my heart has returned to a normal rhythm. Current Music: The strangled, pathetic beating of my heart after having been twisted and turned beyond nature's intention
To sleep with me. Oh, and Prince of Persia rocks my socks Current Music: Elton John - Tiny Dancer

Now I remember what I like about summer... I really missed sleeping in. Anyway, I got some good StarCraft in last night with Nate... eventually the game got so drawn out that we gave up due to boredom... it was pretty bad. I also did a lot of taxi missions yesterday on GTA3... that was cool. Other than that, I really haven't done anything, but I'm going out today to do stuff. Current Music: The Cranberries - Pretty

Well, we laid down the sod about 3 hours faster than we thought we would, and then we had a barbeque, and we played bocce on the new lawn... that was interesting. I then proceeded to get about 20 gold medals for Nate on one of the xbox NFS games... that was interesting. Anyway, be back later. Current Music: No Doubt - Simple Kind of Life Oh, and Happy Fathers day!

I slept for a while... I don't remember if I slept on the couch, or on my floor, or both, but whatever. I just know I got some sleep, and I didn't eat. I'll be off at Nate's tomorrow, putting down sod in part of their yard. Yeah. Well, I'm gonna go find out what we had for dinner. Current Music: The Beatles - The Long and Winding Road

Well, I went to the dentist, and now my face is completely numb on the right side... it's insane. Yeah, and my dad is finishing the new wall outside by putting in two french doors... I just helped him left them up into the frame. That'll be interesting when it's done. Anyway, I've got tons of projects going now, so it's all cool. Oh, yeah, I got accepted into the Networking class... not like that's hard to do, but whatever. So, that'll be fun Current Music: Incubus - Drive

School's Out For The Summer! Yeah... now I get to delve deep into the realm of boredom that summer vacation really is. At least I've got this beast of a physics assignment to do, and I've got a program on hold. So, yeah. Current Music: Chris Isaak - Wicked Game

The AP Physics book is a beast, as well as the summer assignment. I'll probably do it right away, so I don't have to do it last minute before school starts... Anyway, last day of school! Yay! Tomorrow is technically the 181st attendance day, and they don't even take roll, so there's really no point in going. I'm going anyway... But, yeah. Fun stuff. So, I'm going to... oh, wow. I have nothing to do. Insane. I'll eat something and be back. Current Music: Human League - Don't You Want Me

Well, my internet wasn't working for a bit there, but now it is. Whatever. Anyway, I've got to leave pretty soon, here, but it's the second to last day! And we don't have to do anything today! Yeah... Current Music: Hall and Oates - Out of Touch

Well, I had to reformat my computer... and I forgot to get my favorites! Aie! I'm so pissed... I'll never remember all of them... I had some good stuff, too. Anyway, I still have to finish this damned poster. I'll be up all night for this one. Current Music: Franz Ferdinand - Take Me Out
Three finals, two of which were easy. So, yeah. The math one sucked... and I'm guessing I'll get a C-B-ish... Yeah, anyway, I'll be back in a bit.

Muwahaha... I got up early this morning, so I actually get to eat some food. I'm going to be very happy today... hehe... Anyway, I just thought I'd update in the morning, since I have time. It's crazy... my weekend is already filled, and it's not even half way through the week yet. Friday's the last day of school, and there's another concert later in the day. Then Saturday, I'm at Nate's for the first half of the day, spreading sod around by that big brick thing they have... don't ask. After that, I'm supposed to go to some dance thing that Tegan is in, and finally, Sunday, I'm... crap, I don't remember. Whatever. Oh, well... it's father's day, and I was going to go out and buy my dad a new printer, because this one doesn't work on their computer anymore, but it works on mine. Anyway, yeah. I'm done eating breakfast with 12 minutes to go. Awesome! Current Music: The Mars Volta - Cicatriz ESP

Ah, yes. I forgot I had to wait for this download to finish, so I'll just waste some more time. I finally installed Office XP on this computer, so I don't have to use WordPad anymore... I hate that program. Notepad is awesome, of course, but the lack of text formatting doesn't cut it for school assignments. Word is definitely cooler than WordPad... Anyway, with it came Outlook, which I haven't used in a long time, but I got it all wired up and suddenly I'm really organized. It's crazy, and I love it. I started remaking my address book, as I've done many a time, and I put tons of stuff in the calendar, like things that are coming up, and birthdays, and anniversaries, and more. I'd forgotten how good it feels to have your time all organized. Right, well, the download is almost done, so I'm going to check up on a couple LJs and then go to bed. Current Music: Fleetwood Mac - Hold Me

Well, Bert came over and we worked on the brochure and stuff for our utopia... that was interesting. Otherwise, I haven't really done anything. I'm going to order a pick kit, and a jiggler I found on sale. There's also a really cool deal on 8" throwing knives on ebay, and it's the exact knife I've been looking at in a set, but whatever. Perhaps I'll go in debt with my parents... We'll see Anyway, I've got so much to do tomorrow it's not even funny... So, yeah. Off I go Current Music: Animotion - Obsession

'nother typical school day... nothing interesting, really, except science, because we're doing some last-minute physics, which has always been my favorite science. So, that's a bit more entertaining. Anyway, I've got 4 finals... yesterday I thought I only had 2, but no. Health, Math, French, Science in that order. French hardly counts, because it's so easy. Anyway, yeah. Well, I've got to finish my Utopia project, so I'll be off now. Current Music: The Mars Volta - Cicatriz ESP

Yes, yes. I go to bed. Mhmm. Finished Nate's element thing with him, except for the pictures, which he's almost done with, anyway. I never did my map, but whatever, I'll just do it tomorrow. We can plan out where we want stuff or something, and then I can draw the official map tomorrow. Yeah, anyway, I'm off to bed now, so yeah woo... Current Music: The Mars Volta - Tira Me a las Arañas

My sister and family are over for the night, and I'm just sitting around... I still have to work on my map some more, and help Nate with more elements... looks like I've got my night cut out for me (sounds familiar...). Yeah, anyway, I'll update occasionally as I go. Current Music: Moulin Rouge - El Tango De Roxanne

Home again, home again. I still wish they would have told me we were leaving, because now I've got homework to do... Anyway, my cousin graduated, and so did my uncle... that was interesting, of course. Then, we basically lazed around the rest of the time, doing whatever during the day, and watching kung fu movies by night. I've got two awesome movies added to my list, now... I managed to get my parents to let me go to Hastings, so I got the Beatles One album, and my dad got a Buffalo Sprinfield cd... that made the trip home more enjoyable. Anyway, off to that homework I spoke of. I'll update later. Current Music: The Beatles - She Loves You
Well, off to Wenatchee I go. I'll post as soon as I can... Byee!! Current Music: Matchbox 20 - Push

Well, I'm in a better mood now, and I've decided that I'll just make them give me the keys, so I can at least make something out of the car ride. Anyway, I'll try and update from somewhere during the trip, but it's doubtful. Anyway, I'm waiting for my laundry to finish, so I can finish packing and go to bed, so I think I'll find something to do for a bit. I might update when I go to bed. Current Music: Rocky Horror Picture Show Soundtrack - Eddie

*is pissed off* My parents, yet again, forgot to tell me anything at all! Apparently I have to go to Wenatchee all weekend, being picked up from school... I think I'll ride the bus home in spite, and be a total ass... Right, well, whatever. Current Music: Everclear - I Will Buy You a New Life

Yeah... Well, Nate's over, because we have to type up a whole bunch of element thingies to use with that table I made, so he can get mass extra credit in Science. Anyway, yeah. So, I'll be back later. Current Music: Rocky Horror Picture Show - Science Fiction/Double Feature
Oh, I forgot... urlLink Periodic Table of the Elements You can use it for school, or something

Yeah... wow. I was supposed to be in bed 50 minutes ago, so I'm going now. Oh, and it was weird... I just got a beep during a 3-way call... and I was the connector. Weirdness. Right, well, bed. Yeah. I'm starting to think I need the sleep Current Music: U2 - Pride

I am so tired. It's all hot out, and for some reason my bag was really heavy today, and I walked to the student parking lot before I went to the front of the school, so I've exhausted myself. I hate hot weather... Anyway, I'm going to work on that periodic table some more, and I'm going to see if I can't get out of the house later... then I can at least have the AC in the car. Current Music: Eurythmics - Sweet Dreams

Well, I finished the Periodic Table of the Elements, and will be linking it eventually. I have most of the data (#,mass,etc) typed up, but I have to put it all together and make it pop up right and stuff. You'll see. Anywho, I must be going. I think I'll go to bed in a moment, here. Maybe I'll shower first, just for the hell of it. Current Music: Linkin Park - My December

Well, we played another game of StarCraft... Nate and I kicked ass the first game, and then Nate and Matt teamed and Kyle and I got our asses kicked. I kinda got in that lazy/bored mood and built a ton of cannons and nothing else, so the rest of the time was spent watching them pick their way through. Anywho, I'm really bored, now, so I'll be back later. Current Music: Elton John - Your Song

I apologize for being a bit slow on the updating, but I've been working hard. Actually, today I went and drove around and had a bit of fun. I never realized Computer Concepts had such kickass prices on games. I got Decent II, Gunman, Dark Earth, Phantasmagoria, and Rebel Assault II all for $5. It was grand. Yes, anyway. I took apart our launcher and redid most of it with string, and it looks so much better, it's crazy. It's not quite finished, but we've got a couple of class days, so I'll finish tying it up in class tomorrow, and then we can calibrate it with a piece of string. I'll be redoing the blueprint on the computer tomorrow, to make sure it is perfect, because that's what I do. Right, finally, I played a bit of StarCraft today, with Nate, Matt, and Kyle, and I must say I've missed our big 2 vs. 2 games... they're really a lot of fun. Well, I'm working on my digital Periodic Table of the Elements for something Nate needs done in science, so I'm going to get back to work. I'm in a really good working mood right now... Current Music: Rosy Music - More Than This

I've gone on a deviantART spree again, though this one was considerably shorter than the last ones. I'm going to slowly release my Fuerteventura pictures throughout the week, so be on the watch for those, because there's a few cool ones. Anyway, go urlLink check it out . Actually, I took one of the blurry pictures of Amber and played with it, and it turned out massively cool. It was actually a stem of a stem of an idea, so the original idea will have to be played with. The second stem made its way onto devart as well, but it's not nearly as cool. Right, well. I'm off to bed. Oh, Juli's answering machine is awesome. Current Music: Outsider - Your Love
Hmm... well, I'm dying of boredom, and thinking too hard. I believe I'll be getting off to bed, but first I must urlLink spank the monkey . So, yeah. Current Music: Haddaway - What is Love

Well, I just intentionally dug myself in a deeper hole with Katy, and I'm not sure why. I seem to be slowly killing myself via other people, or something. It's crazy. Anyway, I've decided that I'm going to force myself into being a loner next year, so I can get a 4.0... I get too caught up in everything and nothing when I've got this many friends. So I'll just die my hair and wear different clothes, and disappear off the face of the earth. It'll be awesome. Actually, I probably won't, but I was seriously thinking about cutting and dying my hair. It might be interesting. Anyway, I'm off to kill myself. Hah! No, I don't even think I could contemplate suicide, and it's not because of self-esteem, trust me. Right, well. Bye! Current Music: No Doubt - Just A Girl

Well, we built our launcher thingy... it's a bit ghetto, and I still have to draw a blueprint, but it works. Anyway, I was violated beyond belief... and since the grief is still too near to me, I'll just refer you to urlLink Heather and urlLink Tegan 's LiveJournals... I'm not sure when they'll post about it, but just keep watching for it. Anywho, I can just hang around for a while and decide what to do. At the moment I'm playing with PSP on this random art project thing... yeah. Current Music: Linkin Park - Easier to Run

I don't think I've been this bored and/or restless since 7th grade, when I was a loner... This is so lame. Plus, I think I've gotten myself a fever from somewhere or other. Oh, well. I'm just going to sit here and listen to music for a long time... Current Music: Rocky Horror Picture Show - Rose Tint My World: Floor Show/Fanfare/Don't Dream It/Wild and Untamed

Well, we went on a day trip to Whistler... that was interesting. The weather was pretty sucky... it was mass cold, and windy, and raining off and on, and I forgot my gloves. My hands turned purple... and yeah Anyway, we only did 5 or 6 runs, because there was only one chair open, and it wasn't a very interesting one. So, yeah. I'm really sore anyway, but that's mostly from the car ride. I slept both ways, mostly on the way there. Of course, that has nothing to do with the fact that I stayed up all night talking to Juli... *whistles* Anyway, I'm off again. So, yeah Current Music: The Mars Volta - Cut That City

Well, I went to the band thing at the Monroe Boys and Girls Club, and it was massively awesome. urlLink Rhymes End was there, as well as urlLink Smiling Politely , and this band I'd never heard before which was called something like One Carper Green... Anyway, it was awesome, and I'm going to go get the Rhymes End cd, because they roxors my soxors... Current Music: Gary Jules - Mad World

Yeah, wow. Ok. I dunno. Tegan is apparently asleep... pretty early if you ask me. Anyway, I'm off to watch a movie with my parents, even though I've seen it before.... I just went to Home Depot and got some really cool earmuffs, and then to Dairy Queen, where they apparently have an extremely bad night crew... I ordered a banana split (drive-thru), and I pulled up to the window and the lady tries to hand it to me in a dish with the spoon all stuck in it and everything. Like I'm going to eat it while I'm driving. Possible, but very unlikely. Anyway, I kinda gave her a funny look and said, "Can I get a lid and a bag?", "Oh, alright". She hands me the banana split and has me hold it while she goes and gets the lid and the bag, and then just hands me the lid and the bag and closes the window... I'm like, oh great. So, upon attempting to put the lid on, I find that it's actually another bottom piece, so they don't even fit together... So I just crammed it together, stuck it in the bag and hoped for the best... maybe she was new or something... Anyway, off to the movie then Current Music: Rupert Hine - With One Look

Yeah... Anywho, I took my camera today and took a couple pictures just because. I dunno. It was interesting. I didn't take me yearbook, but I signed plenty of them... I'm feeling a bit out of it at the moment, and I apologize, because I think it's showing in this post. I just zoned out for about an hour, and I'm just coming back from it, so it might take me a while to really get moving. Right, well, maybe I'll go back to 'the project' Current Music: Duncan Shiek - Barely Breathing

Well, I've gotten a ton of work done... in fact I've gotten it done twice. I had just gotten to the coloring stage on the picture when the program crashed, and I realized that I hadn't saved it, so I had to redraw the picture, again. At least I'm getting that much more practice. The way I was originally going to shade the picture didn't look very good, so I'm trying something new, and it'll probably look like crap, but I'll just keep working on it until I get it... Anyway, I'm being forced to go to bed, as usual. I'll have to get the dog to scoot over a bit, because she's stolen a considerable amount of my floorspace. Current Music: Franz Ferdinand - Take Me Out
Finally, I'm working on 'the project' again. It's been a while. It's actually quite refreshing, because I'm making some interesting progress... To work! Current Music: The Cranberries - Dreams

Well, I didn't have time to update this morning, because I woke up a bit late, and the filter on the school computers didn't let me update either. The proxy we use to bypass the filters tends to conflict with XML, so that didn't work, either. Anyway, now I'm home, blah, blah. Whatever. So, the day... it was a pretty interesting day, actually... Mr. Dragavon was there today, so 6th period was spent listening to stories and whatnot... *smiles* Dragavon is so cool. Anyway, we got let out a half hour early and we stood in line for about 20 minutes to get yearbooks... the damned things are huge... my math book is smaller! Yeah, so on the bus ride home I decided to see how many seniors I know, and I must say I knew more than I thought I did... Oh, and I'll probably be scanning a lot of the student photos, so be expecting that some time. Right, well, I'm off for now, but I'll be back later (as always) Current Music: Atreyu - Bleeding Hearts

And about time, as well. I never did do my lab write-up for Chem, and at this point I don't really care I'm going to sleep now, and I'll see you in about two hours. *passes out on floor* Current Music: Kevin Shields - City Girl

Well, I got sidetracked for a while and found a whole bunch of cool information on XML, which will really help out. Maybe I can figure out the other end of attributes... I'm nearly done with the quotes, as well. I've only got 5 or 6 left, so perhaps I will get a bit of sleep tonight. Not like I really need it, but I want it... Current Music: Rammstein - Sonne

I'm definitely getting somewhere. It's odd, really, to see which characters I have the easiest time analyzing... I've already finished all of Jack's quotes, and I'm almost done with Roger, whereas I've only got a couple for Ralph and Simon, and none for Piggy. I would have thought that I'd finish Ralph first, and then Jack... and I thought Roger would be the hardest one, especially since I hated his character. Meh, whatever. Back to work Current Music: Louis Bacalov - The Grand Duel

Simon is way to quiet. It's hard to put in quotes to describe his character, because he hardly talked... The only one I have as of yet that really fits into one of the categories is the part when Ralph calls him queer... Ok, back to it. I'm just enjoying these periodic updates Current Music: Twisted Sister - We're Not Gonna Take It

Goddamn, Roger is a creepy kid (Lord of the Flies). I was just working on his quotes, and reliving some of his more ruthless moments. *shudders*... Right, well. On I go. I'm not sure if I'll be able to manage this... I'm still all screwed up from sleeping all day today Current Music: Sarah McLachlan - Possession

Ok, wow... the one day that I really need to get a lot done, I was out on the floor until 8:15 or so... That's what I get for staying up so late last night. Anyway, I have to get back to it Current Music: Wheatus - Teenage Dirtbag
.. but I've got mass homework tonight. Perhaps I'll be back later, if I finish in a timely manner. It really shouldn't be too bad. *runs away to the mountains* Current Music: U2 - New Year's Day

Ok, I'm actually going to go to bed now... I cleaned up some picture out of a science book for Derek, and now I'm ready to pass out, so here it goes... 'Night Current Music: Simple Minds - Don't You Forget About Me

Well, I still haven't beat Sacrifice, but I started playing Ground Control... that's a pretty cool game. Glad I got it. I'll have to try it out multiplayer some time... buwahahaha Ok, sorry. Anyway, Derek is making a webpage... fun stuff. Meanwhile I'm sitting here contemplating what to do next.... Ok, well, I'll be back again. Current Music: Wham - Wake Me Up

Yeah, I've been trying to get this sharing application (WASTE: http://waste.sourceforge.net/) to work for a while now... there's been plenty of router resets and reboots involved, and it's still not working... apparently it's really cool and worth all of the trouble, though... heh Anywho, I'm really bored now... I think I'll go finish off the Sacrifice demo... I keep forgetting I haven't beat it, yet. I'll go do that in a minute. I think I'm going to come up with a money-making scheme, as well.... Current Music: Royksopp - So Easy

Well, I thought I'd play through XIII again, because I really didn't have much to do... I started at 6:30, and by 7:45 I was half way through the game... I'll have to wait a bit longer before the next replay so I can't remember where everything is. It's still awesome, nonetheless Current Music: Simple Minds - Don't You
Oh, and I forgot... I don't know if you noticed, but I changed that page so that you have to point out what browser you have. So, yes.

I did my laundry and stuff and made my bed... I love the smell of new sheets. I haven't slept on them yet, of course, but whatever. Anyway, I also got bored and thought I'd try out the Prince of Persia demo to see how it is on PC. I must say I much prefer it on PlayStation 2, and I was sorely disappointed by the demo, just because I love that game so much and it was far too short of a demo... hehe... not really a good reason, but whatever. Right. I also downloaded Sacrifice, a game I had played once before, and I must say it's a very cool game, although I don't think I'll ever overcome the confusions of the interface... it's a strategy game, where you control different units and such, but it's from the third-person, where you are a wizard controlling all of your units. Also, you can summon, cast spells and so on--the usual stuff. Anywho, it has great graphics and very interesting gameplay, but it's hard... hehe. Whatever. I'm going to go make myself busy. Do enjoy yourselves. Current Music: The Smashing Pumpkins - Love

You know... death should always be a possible side-effect. Of course, I suppose they only include the ones that are a direct cause of the product. But, for example, something that may cause drowsiness could cause you to fall asleep while driving or walking on a narrow catwalk. Of course, then they'd have to include every possible way that falling asleep could kill you... fall asleep and drown, fall asleep and fall off of a train platform, etc. It's amazing the kinds of things people get away with in court these days. It's crazy, because it's not like they could make small claims a thing of the past, because then people would just start shooting each other, or whatever they could do. Anyway, that's the random pile o' whatever for now. Current Music: Lisa Gerrard - Gortoz A Ran

I think I'll take advantage of my current state and make it into a science experiment. I will continue to attempt this one for a while, and fill in the details later. Third Experiment: Caffeine I'll throw this in later when I really start to fall apart.
